IFYDai","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"name":"seriesIterator","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"shutdown","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"name":"signatureCount","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"collateral","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"address","name":"user","type":"address"}],"name":"totalDebtDai","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"totalSeries","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"transferOwnership","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"treasury","outputs":[{"internalType":"contract ITreasury","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"vat","outputs":[{"internalType":"contract IVat","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"collateral","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"address","name":"from","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"to","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"withdraw","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"The Controller manages collateral and debt levels for all users, and it is a major user entry point for the Yield protocol. Controller keeps track of a number of fyDai contracts. Controller allows users to post and withdraw Chai and Weth collateral. Any transactions resulting in a user weth collateral below dust are reverted. Controller allows users to borrow fyDai against their Chai and Weth collateral. Controller allows users to repay their fyDai debt with fyDai or with Dai. Controller integrates with fyDai contracts for minting fyDai on borrowing, and burning fyDai on repaying debt with fyDai. Controller relies on Treasury for all other asset transfers. Controller allows orchestrated contracts to erase any amount of debt or collateral for an user. This is to be used during liquidations or during unwind. Users can delegate the control of their accounts in Controllers to any address.","methods":{"aboveDustOrZero(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Return if the collateral of an user is between zero and the dust level","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type","user":"Address of the user vault"}},"addDelegate(address)":{"details":"Enable a delegate to act on the behalf of caller"},"addDelegateBySignature(address,address,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Add a delegate through an encoded signature"},"batchOrchestrate(address,bytes4[])":{"details":"Adds orchestration for the provided function signatures"},"borrow(bytes32,uint256,address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Mint fyDai for a given series for wallet `to` by increasing the user debt in Yield vault `from` `from` can delegate to other addresses to borrow using his vault. The collateral needed changes according to series maturity and MakerDAO rate and chi, depending on collateral type.","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type.","from":"Yield vault that gets an increased debt.","fyDaiAmount":"Amount of fyDai to borrow.","maturity":"Maturity of an added series","to":"Wallet to put the fyDai in."}},"constructor":{"details":"Set up addresses for vat, pot and Treasury."},"containsSeries(uint256)":{"details":"Returns if a series has been added to the Controller.","params":{"maturity":"Maturity of the series to verify."}},"debtDai(bytes32,uint256,address)":{"details":"Debt in dai of an user After maturity, the Dai debt of a position grows according to either the stability fee (for WETH collateral) or the Dai Saving Rate (for Chai collateral).","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type","maturity":"Maturity of an added series","user":"Address of the user vault"},"returns":{"_0":"Debt in dai of an user"}},"erase(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Removes all collateral and debt for an user, for a given collateral type. This function can only be called by other Yield contracts, not users directly.","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type.","user":"Address of the user vault"},"returns":{"_0":"The amounts of collateral and debt removed from Controller."}},"inDai(bytes32,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Dai equivalent of an fyDai amount. After maturity, the Dai value of an fyDai grows according to either the stability fee (for WETH collateral) or the Dai Saving Rate (for Chai collateral).","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type","fyDaiAmount":"Amount of fyDai to convert.","maturity":"Maturity of an added series"},"returns":{"_0":"Dai equivalent of an fyDai amount."}},"inFYDai(bytes32,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"fyDai equivalent of a Dai amount. After maturity, the fyDai value of a Dai decreases according to either the stability fee (for WETH collateral) or the Dai Saving Rate (for Chai collateral).","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type","daiAmount":"Amount of Dai to convert.","maturity":"Maturity of an added series"},"returns":{"_0":"fyDai equivalent of a Dai amount."}},"isCollateralized(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Return if the borrowing power for a given collateral of a user is equal or greater than its debt for the same collateral","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type","user":"Address of the user vault"}},"locked(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns the amount of collateral locked in borrowing operations.","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type.","user":"Address of the user vault."}},"orchestrate(address,bytes4)":{"details":"Add orchestration","params":{"signature":"bytes4 signature of the function we are giving orchestrated access to. It seems to me a bad idea to give access to humans, and would use this only for predictable smart contracts.","user":"Address of user or contract having access to this contract."}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"post(bytes32,address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Takes collateral assets from `from` address, and credits them to `to` collateral account. `from` can delegate to other addresses to take assets from him. Also needs to use `ERC20.approve`. Calling ERC20.approve for Treasury contract is a prerequisite to this function","params":{"amount":"Amount of collateral to move.","collateral":"Valid collateral type.","from":"Wallet to take collateral from.","to":"Yield vault to put the collateral in."}},"powerOf(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Borrowing power (in dai) of a user for a specific series and collateral.","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type","user":"Address of the user vault"},"returns":{"_0":"Borrowing power of an user in dai."}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"repayDai(bytes32,uint256,address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Burns Dai from `from` wallet to repay debt in a Yield Vault. User debt is decreased for the given collateral and fyDai series, in Yield vault `to`. The amount of debt repaid changes according to series maturity and MakerDAO rate and chi, depending on collateral type. `from` can delegate to other addresses to take Dai from him for the repayment. Calling ERC20.approve for Treasury contract is a prerequisite to this function","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type.","daiAmount":"Amount of Dai to use for debt repayment.","from":"Wallet providing the Dai for repayment.","maturity":"Maturity of an added series","to":"Yield vault to repay debt for."}},"repayFYDai(bytes32,uint256,address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Burns fyDai from `from` wallet to repay debt in a Yield Vault. User debt is decreased for the given collateral and fyDai series, in Yield vault `to`. `from` can delegate to other addresses to take fyDai from him for the repayment.","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type.","from":"Wallet providing the fyDai for repayment.","fyDaiAmount":"Amount of fyDai to use for debt repayment.","maturity":"Maturity of an added series","to":"Yield vault to repay debt for."}},"revokeDelegate(address)":{"details":"Stop a delegate from acting on the behalf of caller"},"shutdown()":{"details":"Disables post, withdraw, borrow and repay. To be called only when Treasury shuts down."},"totalDebtDai(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Total debt of an user across all series, in Dai The debt is summed across all series, taking into account interest on the debt after a series matures. This function loops through all maturities, limiting the contract to hundreds of maturities.","params":{"collateral":"Valid collateral type","user":"Address of the user vault"},"returns":{"_0":"Total debt of an user across all series, in Dai"}},"totalSeries()":{"details":"Return the total number of series registered"},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"withdraw(bytes32,address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Returns collateral to `to` wallet, taking it from `from` Yield vault account. `from` can delegate to other addresses to take assets from him.","params":{"amount":"Amount of collateral to move.","collateral":"Valid collateral type.","from":"Yield vault to take collateral from.","to":"Wallet to put the collateral documentation.text:
@dev The Controller manages collateral and debt levels for all users, and it is a major user entry point for the Yield protocol.
 Controller keeps track of a number of fyDai contracts.
 Controller allows users to post and withdraw Chai and Weth collateral.
 Any transactions resulting in a user weth collateral below dust are reverted.
 Controller allows users to borrow fyDai against their Chai and Weth collateral.
 Controller allows users to repay their fyDai debt with fyDai or with Dai.
 Controller integrates with fyDai contracts for minting fyDai on borrowing, and burning fyDai on repaying debt with fyDai.
 Controller relies on Treasury for all other asset transfers.
 Controller allows orchestrated contracts to erase any amount of debt or collateral for an user. This is to be used during liquidations or during unwind.
 Users can delegate the control of their accounts in Controllers to any address.
@dev Set up addresses for vat, pot and Treasury.
@dev Modified functions only callable while the Controller is not unwinding due to a MakerDAO shutdown.
@dev Only valid collateral types are Weth and Chai.
@dev Only series added through `addSeries` are valid.
@dev Safe casting from uint256 to int256
@dev Disables post, withdraw, borrow and repay. To be called only when Treasury shuts down.
@dev Return the total number of series registered

@dev Returns if a series has been added to the Controller.
 @param maturity Maturity of the series to verify.

@dev The Controller manages collateral and debt levels for all users, and it is a major user entry point for the Yield protocol.
 Controller keeps track of a number of fyDai contracts.
 Controller allows users to post and withdraw Chai and Weth collateral.
 Any transactions resulting in a user weth collateral below dust are reverted.
 Controller allows users to borrow fyDai against their Chai and Weth collateral.
 Controller allows users to repay their fyDai debt with fyDai or with Dai.
 Controller integrates with fyDai contracts for minting fyDai on borrowing, and burning fyDai on repaying debt with fyDai.
 Controller relies on Treasury for all other asset transfers.
 Controller allows orchestrated contracts to erase any amount of debt or collateral for an user. This is to be used during liquidations or during unwind.
 Users can delegate the control of their accounts in Controllers to any address.
@dev Set up addresses for vat, pot and Treasury.
@dev Modified functions only callable while the Controller is not unwinding due to a MakerDAO shutdown.
@dev Only valid collateral types are Weth and Chai.
@dev Only series added through `addSeries` are valid.
@dev Safe casting from uint256 to int256
@dev Disables post, withdraw, borrow and repay. To be called only when Treasury shuts down.
@dev Return the total number of series registered

@dev Returns if a series has been added to the Controller.
 @param maturity Maturity of the series to verify.

devdoc.details: The Controller manages collateral and debt levels for all users, and it is a major user entry point for the Yield protocol. Controller keeps track of a number of fyDai contracts. Controller allows users to post and withdraw Chai and Weth collateral. Any transactions resulting in a user weth collateral below dust are reverted. Controller allows users to borrow fyDai against their Chai and Weth collateral. Controller allows users to repay their fyDai debt with fyDai or with Dai. Controller integrates with fyDai contracts for minting fyDai on borrowing, and burning fyDai on repaying debt with fyDai. Controller relies on Treasury for all other asset transfers. Controller allows orchestrated contracts to erase any amount of debt or collateral for an user. This is to be used during liquidations or during unwind. Users can delegate the control of their accounts in Controllers to any address.

aboveDustOrZero(bytes32,address).details: Return if the collateral of an user is between zero and the dust level

addDelegate(address).details: Enable a delegate to act on the behalf of caller

addDelegateBySignature(address,address,u.details: Add a delegate through an encoded signature

batchOrchestrate(address,bytes4[]).details: Adds orchestration for the provided function signatures

borrow(bytes32,uint256,address,address,u.details: Mint fyDai for a given series for wallet `to` by increasing the user debt in Yield vault `from` `from` can delegate to other addresses to borrow using his vault. The collateral needed changes according to series maturity and MakerDAO rate and chi, depending on collateral type.

params.from: Yield vault that gets an increased debt.
params.to: Wallet to put the fyDai in.

constructor.details: Set up addresses for vat, pot and Treasury.

containsSeries(uint256).details: Returns if a series has been added to the Controller.

params.maturity: Maturity of the series to verify.

debtDai(bytes32,uint256,address).details: Debt in dai of an user After maturity, the Dai debt of a position grows according to either the stability fee (for WETH collateral) or the Dai Saving Rate (for Chai collateral).

returns._0: Debt in dai of an user

erase(bytes32,address).details: Removes all collateral and debt for an user, for a given collateral type. This function can only be called by other Yield contracts, not users directly.

returns._0: The amounts of collateral and debt removed from Controller.

inDai(bytes32,uint256,uint256).details: Dai equivalent of an fyDai amount. After maturity, the Dai value of an fyDai grows according to either the stability fee (for WETH collateral) or the Dai Saving Rate (for Chai collateral).

returns._0: Dai equivalent of an fyDai amount.

inFYDai(bytes32,uint256,uint256).details: fyDai equivalent of a Dai amount. After maturity, the fyDai value of a Dai decreases according to either the stability fee (for WETH collateral) or the Dai Saving Rate (for Chai collateral).

returns._0: fyDai equivalent of a Dai amount.

isCollateralized(bytes32,address).details: Return if the borrowing power for a given collateral of a user is equal or greater than its debt for the same collateral

locked(bytes32,address).details: Returns the amount of collateral locked in borrowing operations.

params.signature: bytes4 signature of the function we are giving orchestrated access to. It seems to me a bad idea to give access to humans, and would use this only for predictable smart contracts.
params.user: Address of user or contract having access to this contract.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

post(bytes32,address,address,uint256).details: Takes collateral assets from `from` address, and credits them to `to` collateral account. `from` can delegate to other addresses to take assets from him. Also needs to use `ERC20.approve`. Calling ERC20.approve for Treasury contract is a prerequisite to this function

params.to: Yield vault to put the collateral in.

powerOf(bytes32,address).details: Borrowing power (in dai) of a user for a specific series and collateral.

returns._0: Borrowing power of an user in dai.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

repayDai(bytes32,uint256,address,address.details: Burns Dai from `from` wallet to repay debt in a Yield Vault. User debt is decreased for the given collateral and fyDai series, in Yield vault `to`. The amount of debt repaid changes according to series maturity and MakerDAO rate and chi, depending on collateral type. `from` can delegate to other addresses to take Dai from him for the repayment. Calling ERC20.approve for Treasury contract is a prerequisite to this function

params.daiAmount: Amount of Dai to use for debt repayment.
params.from: Wallet providing the Dai for repayment.
params.to: Yield vault to repay debt for.

repayFYDai(bytes32,uint256,address,addre.details: Burns fyDai from `from` wallet to repay debt in a Yield Vault. User debt is decreased for the given collateral and fyDai series, in Yield vault `to`. `from` can delegate to other addresses to take fyDai from him for the repayment.

params.from: Wallet providing the fyDai for repayment.
params.fyDaiAmount: Amount of fyDai to use for debt repayment.
params.to: Yield vault to repay debt for.

revokeDelegate(address).details: Stop a delegate from acting on the behalf of caller

shutdown().details: Disables post, withdraw, borrow and repay. To be called only when Treasury shuts down.

totalDebtDai(bytes32,address).details: Total debt of an user across all series, in Dai The debt is summed across all series, taking into account interest on the debt after a series matures. This function loops through all maturities, limiting the contract to hundreds of maturities.

returns._0: Total debt of an user across all series, in Dai

totalSeries().details: Return the total number of series registered

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdraw(bytes32,address,address,uint256.details: Returns collateral to `to` wallet, taking it from `from` Yield vault account. `from` can delegate to other addresses to take assets from him.

params.from: Yield vault to take collateral from.
params.to: Wallet to put the collateral in.
